## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
rm(list = ls())

```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| label: load-data
#| eval: true

library(GEOquery)
library(stringr)

raw_dir <- "data/_raw/"
data_file <- "GDS6063_full.soft.gz"
data_loc <- "https://ftp.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/datasets/GDS6nnn/GDS6063/soft/"  # example GEO FTP path

if (!dir.exists(raw_dir)) {
  dir.create(path = raw_dir, recursive = TRUE)
}
if (!file.exists(str_c(raw_dir, data_file))) {
  download.file(
    url = str_c(data_loc, data_file),
    destfile = str_c(raw_dir, data_file)
  )
}

# Load the SOFT file
gds <- getGEO(filename = str_c(raw_dir, data_file))

```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
